title: SLPP member linked to ICE chemical haul in Middeniya
byline: A Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) member and his brother have been implicated in the discovery of nearly 50,000 kilograms of chemicals used in the production of crystal methamphetamine (ice) during a police raid at a property in Middeniya, Thalawa, on Friday (5).

title: Govt. soft-pedals on NGOs
byline: The government has delayed the enactment of the proposed piece of legislation for monitoring and supervision of both local and international NGOs despite the availability of a draft worked out during the previous rule, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Two shooting incidents reported in Colombo and Negombo
byline:
Two separate shooting incidents were reported in the Grandpass police division and in Negombo last night and this morning, police said.

A 26-year-old resident of Kelaniya was killed in a shooting near the Mahawatta clock tower in Grandpass last night (5). Two unidentified gunmen on a motorcycle had opened fire at the victim before fleeing the scene. The injured man was admitted to the Colomb

title: Animal killing on the rise: Authorities go after poachers
byline: In light of the increased illegal hunting activity resulting in the deaths of wildlife, authorities have stepped up efforts to apprehend poachers operating in wildlife reserves.

title: Over 100,000 vehicles registered without mumber plates
byline: The Department of Motor Transport has been unable to issue number plates for more than 100,000 newly registered vehicles due to the suspension of number plate printing for the past six months.

title: CEB ‘work-to-rule’ campaign enters second day
byline: The ‘work-to-rule’ trade union action launched by employees of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) in protest against the government’s plan to divide the institution into four entities continued for the second consecutive day today (6).

title: Former India cricketer backs Sri Lanka as Asia Cup 2025 finalists
byline: With just days left for the highly anticipated Asia Cup 2025 tournament set to happen in the UAE from September 9 to 28, Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra said Sri Lanka could very well be the team to make the finals alongside India.

title: Shasheendra Rajapaksa admitted to Prison hospital
byline: Former State Minister Shasheendra Rajapaksa, who is being held in remand custody, has been admitted to the Prison Hospital, the Prisons Department said.

title: Dudley Sirisena pledges to remove unauthorised section of Sudu Araliya Hotel
byline: Business magnate Dudley Sirisena announced that he will demolish the portion of his Sudu Araliya Hotel identified as an unauthorised construction.

title: Pakistan tones down Defence and Martyrs’ Day observation due to floods
byline: Pakistan has decided to tone down this year’s celebration of Defence and Martyrs’ Day due to the ongoing devastating floods across Pakistan and in solidarity with the victims and their families, according to the Pakistani High Commission.

title: SLPP suspends Angunakolapelessa member over drug probe
byline: The Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) has suspended the party membership of Sampath Manamperi following allegations that he was in possession of raw materials used for drug production.

title: Over 100,000 vehicles registered without number plates
byline: The Department of Motor Transport has been unable to issue number plates for more than 100,000 newly registered vehicles due to the suspension of number plate printing for the past six months.
